question.Title: Why do I have this difference when subtracting terms to near zero in Python?
question.Body:
When I run this into the compiler:

print (7/3)print (4/3)print (7/3-4/3-1)print ("")print (5/3)print (2/3)print (5/3-2/3-1)

The console outputs: 

2.33333333333333351.33333333333333332.220446049250313e-161.66666666666666670.66666666666666660.0

Why does the compiler round 7/3 to 5 at the 16th digit? Other calculators say 7/3 is just 2.333(repeating 3)Also, why does the compiler round the solution for 5/3 but not 2/3?
